image.altText: A police officer stands in front of a home.

items.synopsis: A 92-year-old man charged with murdering his wife appears in the ACT Magistrates Court via video link as part of a bedside hearing.

title.children: Canberra man Donald Morley charged with murdering his 92-year-old wife Jean Morley

image.altText: Woman sits in front of a bookshelf.

items.synopsis: The Reserve Bank leaves interest rates on hold for the second month in a row, raising questions about whether it may be finished hiking borrowing costs.

title.children: Kimberley is about to roll off a fixed mortgage. She doesn't think she can make the repayments even if rates don't rise further

image.altText: Pregnant

items.synopsis: The Canberra Hospital's obstetrics and gynaecology department is at risk of losing its training accreditation after a new report revealed it failed to meet five of six overview standards.

title.children: Report details inadequate training at Canberra Hospital's obstetrics and gynecology department

image.altText: Rohan smiles, sitting next to an adult on the couch. He has brown hair.

items.synopsis: Juvenile arthritis is one of the most common chronic diseases affecting Australian children, but a scarcity of specialists is making diagnosis and care a challenge.

title.children: Rohan started struggling to walk as a toddler — it took months to diagnose juvenile arthritis

image.altText: A person holding up a phone with the TiktTok app open.

items.synopsis: A committee into the use of social media as a means of foreign interference in Australia has found that applications TikTok and WeChat could be the country's biggest security risks.

title.children: TikTok and WeChat could be biggest national security threat to Australia, report says

image.altText: An image showing half underwater, half sunset.

items.synopsis: Australia's Bureau of Meteorology says an El Niño event — the world's most consequential climate driver — is "likely in the coming weeks", but has not joined international agencies in declaring it's already underway. Here's why.

title.children: Is El Niño still likely to form?

image.altText: Lauren James threading a pass

items.synopsis: Big dogs USA, England, Portugal and the Netherlands are all in action tonight, with Groups D and E being finalised at the Women's World Cup. Follow live.

title.children: England crusing against China, on verge of World Cup knock-out rounds

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: After a couple of OK performances, the Lionesses are finally starting to roar. They have not looked for one second like they're not winning this match against China, who have largely had to watch England pass circles around them. So it's looking like England and Australia are avoiding each other for now. If England don't fall in a heap after the break, they will play Nigeria in Brisbane on Monday.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: HALF-TIME: China 0 - 3 England

children.content: After a couple of OK performances, the Lionesses are finally starting to roar.
They have not looked for one second like they're not winning this match against China, who have largely had to watch England pass circles around them.
So it's looking like England and Australia are avoiding each other for now.
If England don't fall in a heap after the break, they will play Nigeria in Brisbane on Monday.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Haiti have had their moments in this one, but it's largely been Denmark attacking in waves. They could be further in front. For now, the Danes will be very happy with this result, as it puts them through as well.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: HALF-TIME: Haiti 0 - 1 Denmark

children.content: Haiti have had their moments in this one, but it's largely been Denmark attacking in waves. They could be further in front.
For now, the Danes will be very happy with this result, as it puts them through as well.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Superbly worked free kick, they made it look easy. It's just slid to the feet of James who guides it into the net through a thicket of bodies. England are cruising.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 41' GOAL LAUREN JAMES

children.content: Superbly worked free kick, they made it look easy.
It's just slid to the feet of James who guides it into the net through a thicket of bodies.

image.altText: A lone Desert Kurrajong sits close to the sea

items.synopsis: Against the dry, arid landscapes of west and central Australia, these trees not only catch your eye, but are a source of food and water and can point you in the right direction if you're lost.

title.children: 'Who planted them?': One of the outback's most unusual trees is a native wonder with remarkable features

image.altText: A footballer leaves the field looking dazed.

items.synopsis: Hawthorn ruckman Max Lynch retires from the AFL on the advice of doctors, as the partner of a former Port Adelaide player details "scary" concussion incidents at the club.

title.children: Hawk ruckman forced to retire from AFL due to concussion, as more Port claims emerge

image.altText: Generic Australian Federal Police

items.synopsis: The Gold Coast man, 45, has been charged with 136 counts of rape and 110 counts of sexual intercourse with a child under 10.

title.children: Former childcare worker charged with 1,623 child abuse offences against 91 children

image.altText: Anne Pedler with two young boys.

items.synopsis: Stella says it took her weeks to bring herself to read the report of her mum's death at Launceston General Hospital, fearful of what she knew it would contain — saying "it's a place that you go to be healed and treated, but it's letting you down so badly".

title.children: 'There was no-one there for her': Daughter mourns mum as coroner lashes hospital where 71yo died while ramped

image.altText: Two men next to a beach

items.synopsis: What's going on with the weather in Australia? It's partly the result of natural drivers of our weather – and partly due to global warming, writes Andrew King.

title.children: Why is Australia having such a warm winter?

image.altText: A woman holding a phone to take a photo hit by a wave.

items.synopsis: Footage shows Beijing's streets becoming rivers and residents being pulled from submerged cars as the remnants of Typhoon Doksuri bring record downpours to Northern China.

title.children: In pictures: Scenes of devastation and dramatic rescues as extreme rain batters China

image.altText: Abdourahmane Tiani in military gear surrounded by four other men also in army uniform.

items.synopsis: After climbing the ranks of Niger's army, Abdourahamane Tiani was handed one of the military's most prized appointments: the head of an elite unit set up to protect the president. Last week, he used his position to do the opposite.

title.children: Who is the Niger general who ousted a president he was meant to protect?

image.altText: Myanmar's State Counsellor Aung San Suu Kyi delivers an opening speech.

items.synopsis: Myanmar's ruling military pardons jailed former leader Aung San Suu Kyi on five of the 19 offences for which she was jailed for a total of 33 years, after she was recently transferred from prison to home detention.

title.children: Ousted Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi pardoned for some convictions after transfer to home detention

image.altText: A woman leaves court with her face covered.

items.synopsis: A woman who was banned from owning dogs in Victoria has avoided imprisonment after more than 300 dogs were found on her Murray Mallee property, a court hears.

title.children: Dog breeder fined $5,000 over animal cruelty offences

image.altText: A man in a black jacket takes a selfie at the top of a high rise building.

items.synopsis: It is believed he was last seen alive knocking on a penthouse window of the building on Thursday.

title.children: Internet-famous French daredevil reported dead in fall from Hong Kong apartment building

image.altText: Alanna Kennedy and Katrina Gorry wearing blue Matildas away jerseys, celebrating their win

items.synopsis: We won't know who the Matildas will play next until after tonight's matches, but we know where they'll be playing — and what colours they'll be wearing.

title.children: What we know about the Matildas' next game

image.altText: A black and white photo of Richard Milgin

items.synopsis: An inquest hears Richard Milgin went missing nearly 30 years ago after leaving with his "forbidden" partner, Julie Buck, whose remains were found 12 months later.

title.children: Coroner's Court hears missing Kimberley man may have been victim of tribal punishment

image.altText: Paul McCarthy live in Glastonbury, with John Lennon behind him.

items.synopsis: Legendary musician Paul McCartney has announced he will bring his Got Back tour to Australia in October with Newcastle and the Gold Coast in the line-up.

title.children: Paul McCartney to visit regional cities for first time on upcoming Australian tour

image.altText: A home being moved with a crane

items.synopsis: Bond Homes employed 20 full-time staff and been building transportable homes for nearly 30 years, which were ordered from across regional Victoria.

title.children: Ballarat-based home builder goes under, leaving clients' dreams up in the air

image.altText: Philip Lowe wearing glasses and a suit sits at a table and speaks.

items.synopsis: The RBA elected to leave the cash rate on hold at 4.1 per cent for a second month in a row, but flagged future increases might be necessary to stem inflation. Look back on the day's business and financial news with our blog.

title.children: RBA warns another rate hike may be on the cards despite holding off in August — as it happened

image.altText: A southern right whale and dolphin swim together in the ocean.

items.synopsis: A whale conservation group reacts angrily to the SA government's decision to permanently allow year-round commercial rock lobster fishing in a breeding area, intended to give the industry more flexibility.

title.children: Fury over 'ludicrous' commercial fishing decision in whale nursery

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt and glasses stand in a field in front of a huge antenna.

items.synopsis: NASA's giant dish antenna in Canberra is on the lookout for signals from the Voyager 2 spacecraft, after flight controllers accidentally severed communications more than a week ago.

title.children: Canberra dish on lookout for lost Voyager 2 spacecraft

image.altText: A handcuffed man lying on a road surrounded by heavily armed police.

items.synopsis: A man who threatened police with a gun then carjacked an Uber driver in East Perth and ordered him to speed before police were forced to crash into the car to stop it, is sentenced to prison.

title.children: Gunman who carjacked and bit Uber driver on busy freeway jailed

image.altText: Two middle-aged women walk up the stairs of the NT Supreme Court in Darwin

items.synopsis: A mother and son duo who tried to cover-up the hit-and-run death of an Aboriginal woman have pleaded guilty to a string of serious charges.

title.children: Mother and son admit to criminal cover up of fatal hit and run after discovery of woman's leg

image.altText: Charlie Read looks at the camera.

items.synopsis: The son of one of Australia's most notorious criminals pleads not guilty to drugs, stealing and gun charges over an arrest in Hobart earlier this year.

title.children: Son of Chopper pleads not guilty to gun, drug offences after road spike arrest

image.altText: Ben Stokes and Pat Cummins smile

items.synopsis: A lot has happened over the past seven weeks during this Ashes series. Here are some of the key moments from each nailbiting Test.

title.children: Possibly the greatest Ashes series of all time just finished. Here's how it went down

image.altText: a house engulfed in flames

items.synopsis: A 37-year-old man, who neighbours say lived at the home with his mum and partner, is recovering after suffering severe burns to his entire body.

title.children: Police probe whether suspicious Gold Coast house fire was domestic violence incident

image.altText: Hunter Biden, wearing suits, departs federal court after a plea hearing

items.synopsis: Hunter Biden would often put his famous father on speakerphone to impress clients and business associates, a congressional probe has heard. However, the current US president was never directly involved in their financial dealings. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: Hunter Biden accused of creating 'illusion of access' to Joe Biden during business dealings

image.altText: Angus Cloud, dressed in a purple top, clasps his hands together on the red carpet.

items.synopsis: The actor, best known for playing drug dealer Fezco in HBO show Euphoria, has died aged 25.

title.children: Euphoria actor Angus Cloud dies

image.altText: Michael and Sam, wearing green formal wear, are surrounded by green and gold balloons.

items.synopsis: Samantha Lilly first competed in the World Dwarf Games in 2009, bringing home a swag of medals in the pool. This year she's returning as the Australian team's co-captain, alongside Michael Spain.

title.children: Why competing at the World Dwarf Games is so important to Samantha
